subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* [[Index:Chinese radical/曰]]
* {{l|mul|[[昌]], [[替]], [[曷]], [[曾]], [[會]], [[書]], [[曹]], [[朁]]}} <!-- Note: 冒 and 曼 are derived from 冃 not 曰 --> <!-- 旦 is derived from 日 not 曰 -->

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: * Not to be confused with [[日]], which is generally slimmer and taller, and has a middle stroke that often extends to both sides in non-{{w|regular script}} fonts.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}

{{liushu|i}}: a mouth ({{zh-l|*口}}) with word or breath ({{zh-l|*一}}) coming out. Compare {{zh-l|*今}} and {{zh-l|*言}}, where a small stroke is also used to represent words.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Cognate with {{och-l|話}} according to {{zh-ref|Sagart (1999)}}; if so, it is from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*grwas||to speak; word}}.

{{etystub|zh}}

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{†}} to [[say]]; to [[speak]]
#* {{zh-x|翁 笑 曰：「平 昔 不 相 往 還，何 由 遺 魂 吾 家？」|The old man laughed and '''said''', "In normal days we don't have much of a relation, why would you want to call back the dead's soul in my house?"|CL|ref={{w2|zh|聊齋志異}}, {{w2|zh|s:聊齋志異/第02卷|第2卷}}}} <!--English translation from [[w:Classical Chinese lexicon]]-->
# {{†}} to be [[call]]ed (the [[name]] of)

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|念子曰|吊子曰兒|子曰行|子曰詩云|或曰|調子曰兒|詩云子曰}}

subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: Named as {{m|ja|平日|tr=hirabi||lit=[[wide]] ''hi''}} to distinguish from the {{m|ja|日|tr=hi||[[sun]], [[day]]}} ''kanji''.
